intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri var. albescens, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
